<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/13/doj-shows-no-mercy-aunt-becky?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The DOJ Shows No Mercy on Aunt Becky
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Justice Department <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/juliareinstein/felicity-huffman-lori-loughlin-college-entrance-cheating?ref=bfnsplash" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">charged</a> 50 people—including <em>Full House </em>actress Lori Loughlin and <em>Desperate Housewives</em> star Felicity Huffman—for their involvement in a long-running bribery scheme to get their kids into top U.S. colleges. And here we thought the key was being sergeant-at-arms of the National Honor Society.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The claims: </strong>From 2011 to 2018, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/fbi-accuses-wealthy-parents-including-celebrities-in-college-entrance-bribery-scheme/2019/03/12/d91c9942-44d1-11e9-8aab-95b8d80a1e4f_story.html?utm_term=.8da789757b9f" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about $25 million</a> in bribes was paid out to officials at schools including Yale, Georgetown, Stanford, UCLA, Wake Forest, and more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The alleged wrongdoing</strong> included cheating on college entrance exams like the SAT and ACT and bribing coaches to say students were being <a href="https://twitter.com/jackdickey/status/1105478734331723776" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recruited as athletes</a>…“regardless of their athletic abilities, and in some cases, even though they did not play the sport they were purportedly recruited to play.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For example, Loughlin and her husband were charged with paying $500,000 in bribes to get their two daughters into USC as recruits for the rowing team...even though neither knew a coxswain from a stroke.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's one example:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1552423528.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Via <a href="https://twitter.com/jackdickey" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@jackdickey</a></em></sup></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The roster of those charged reads like the Met Gala invite list</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re talking tiger parents like Huffman and Loughlin, Hercules Capital CEO Manuel Henriquez, ex-Pacific Investment Management CEO Douglas Hodge, and TPG Head of <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-12/tpg-s-bill-mcglashan-among-defendants-charged-in-college-scheme" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Social Good</a> William McGlashan.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wondering what this scheme would run you?</strong> Prosecutors said parents <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-12/coaches-accused-by-u-s-in-scheme-over-college-entrance-exams?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paid anywhere</a> from $100,000 to $6.5 million in bribes, with most payments totaling about $200,000. Each time a parent wanted to cheat a standardized test, they’d dish out $15,000 to $75,000, but we could've told them for free all you need to do is pick "C." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The alleged fraud was the “largest college admittance scam ever charged by the Department of Justice,” <a href="https://www.axios.com/college-admittance-fraud-felicity-huffman-lori-loughlin-bf1fb194-1c73-4938-b268-b911e5ba421a.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officials said</a>. And it confirms two long-held suspicions: 1) America’s rich hold the country’s elite university system in the palm of their hands, and 2) getting kids into the party school revered higher learning institute of their dreams is big business.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F03%2F13%2Fdoj-shows-no-mercy-aunt-becky" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+roster+of+those+charged+reads+like+the+Met+Gala+invite+list&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/13/doj-shows-no-mercy-aunt-becky&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/13/europe-thing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Europe Does Its Own Thing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The EU’s aviation safety regulator, EASA, joined other countries around the globe in <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/12/european-aviation-regulator-easa-suspends-all-boeing-737-max-operations-in-europe.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grounding Boeing’s 737 Max jet</a>, the plane involved in two fatal crashes over the past five months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is unexpected.</strong> EASA and the FAA, the U.S. regulator, have a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/12/business/boeing-737-grounding-faa.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">history of working together</a>. So it’s surprising that the Europeans consider the popular plane a danger to safety while the U.S. has vouched for its "continued airworthiness."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And what about Boeing?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shares are falling as quickly as its reputation, down more than 6% yesterday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It will make a </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-to-make-key-change-in-max-cockpit-software-11552413489?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">software update</a></span><span> to the stall-prevention system in the 737 Max, although it was working on this change before Sunday’s crash in Ethiopia.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's a useful map from <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-12/boeing-737-max-grounded-by-u-k-in-biggest-blow-yet-to-u-s-jet" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1552437966.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Europe is brushing off the U.S. in other ways, too</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/drop-huawei-or-see-intelligence-sharing-pared-back-u-s-tells-germany-11552314827" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> German officials that it would limit intelligence data sharing if Germany tapped Huawei—the Chinese telecom considered a national security threat by the White House—to build out the country’s next-gen networks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Chancellor Angela Merkel’s response? </strong>“We are <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/12/germany-will-set-own-standards-on-huawei-merkel-says.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defining</a> our [security] standards for ourselves.”</p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH CARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/13/unitedhealth-takes-one-passes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
UnitedHealth Takes One and Passes It On
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Health insurer UnitedHealth Group (+1.12%) announced yesterday that, starting next year, it’ll <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-healthcare-rebates-unitedhealth/unitedhealth-expands-discount-program-to-new-employer-sponsored-plans-idUSKBN1QT175" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expand a program</a> that passes on drug discounts directly to consumers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What does that mean? </strong></span><span>People who’ve struggled with high deductible payments and other out-of-pocket expenses could see their costs come down.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>UnitedHealth will require new clients to apply after-the-fact discounts (aka rebates) to consumers’ out-of-pocket expenses. <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/12/health/unitedhealthcare-lower-drug-prices-rebates.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Per the NYT</a>, other companies have <em>offered</em> similar deals to employers, but UnitedHealth looks to be the first major insurer to <em>require</em> it (FYI, existing clients will be permitted to continue under the old system but are “encouraged” to switch).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So why now? </strong>Nothing like a little D.C. pressure to move the ball down the field. Lawmakers have blamed rebate programs for pushing up the list price of drugs and burdening consumers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">UnitedHealth said the expanded program will make consumers more likely to fill their prescriptions. As it already exists, the program has lowered drug costs by an average of $130 per eligible prescription.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/13/dick-s-sticks-guns-kinda?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dick's Sticks to Its Guns...Kinda
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1552429563.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the largest firearms sellers in the U.S. is moving further away from...firearms. Dick’s Sporting Goods (-11.17%) announced yesterday it’ll remove guns and other hunting goods from 125 of its stores.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some background: </strong>Just over a year ago, Dick’s CEO Edward Stack learned the Parkland gunman <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/12/business/dicks-sporting-goods-stock-gun-control.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">once bought a gun</a> from Dick’s. While that wasn’t the gun he used to kill 17 people last year, Stack was shaken.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That’s why he’s made it harder to buy guns at Dick’s—and why he’s </span><span><a href="https://thehill.com/business-a-lobbying/433735-dicks-sporting-goods-pulling-guns-from-125-stores?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pressured Congress</a></span><span> to pass gun safety measures.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dick’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/dicks-sporting-goods-to-remove-guns-from-125-stores-11552400663?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested</a> the fewer-guns approach in 10 stores last year. And if the expansion announced yesterday is successful, Dick’s will move to implement the same changes at more locations next year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Stack’s approach has invited both support and criticism...it could potentially hurt Dick’s business. Adjusted same-store sales fell 3.1% annually last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But there are larger forces at work: </strong>Gun demand (especially in brick-and-mortar stores) has been under pressure—U.S. firearm sales fell 12.4% year-over-year last month, <a href="http://smallarmsanalytics.com/v1/pr/2019-03-06.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimates</a> Small Arms Analytics & Forecasting.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/03/13/moviepass-can-t-count-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
MoviePass: You Can’t Count on Us
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">MoviePass’s parent company, Helios and Matheson Analytics (-3.57%), admitted to an error objectively worse than us fudging yesterday’s share section.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a filing with the SEC, <a href="https://sqoop.com/details/sec/0001213900-19-003937?aid=2718506&utm_medium=email&utm_source=s_alert#form" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it wrote</a> that:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The board and the audit committee determined “the company's previously issued quarterly and year-to-date unaudited consolidated financial statements for September 30, 2018, </span><span><strong style="color:#000"><em>should no longer be relied upon</em></strong></span><span>.” Our emphasis.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Similarly, “Related press releases, earnings releases, and investor communications describing the Company’s financial statements for these periods </span><span><strong style="color:#000"><em>should no longer be relied upon.</em></strong></span><span>”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Boil it down: </strong>The company overstated subscription revenues in Q3 2018 while <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/moviepass-parent-company-says-it-underestimated-losses-2019-3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">understating</a> its net loss by nearly 7%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">MoviePass, the subscription movie service that in summer 2018 had 3.2 million subscribers (who knows how many now?), is hoping its latest <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/03/06/after-an-extremely-rough-year-moviepass-attempts-to-refocus/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">business model tweak</a> will be the one that carves a path toward sustainability. The new strategy involves closely integrating the MoviePass subscription with MoviePass Films (film production) and Moviefone (film info).</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Justice Department \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/juliareinstein/felicity-huffman-lori-loughlin-college-entrance-cheating?ref=bfnsplash\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echarged\u003c/a\u003e 50 people—including \u003cem\u003eFull House \u003c/em\u003eactress Lori Loughlin and \u003cem\u003eDesperate Housewives\u003c/em\u003e star Felicity Huffman—for their involvement in a long-running bribery scheme to get their kids into top U.S. colleges. And here we thought the key was being sergeant-at-arms of the National Honor Society.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe claims: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom 2011 to 2018, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/fbi-accuses-wealthy-parents-including-celebrities-in-college-entrance-bribery-scheme/2019/03/12/d91c9942-44d1-11e9-8aab-95b8d80a1e4f_story.html?utm_term=.8da789757b9f\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout $25 million\u003c/a\u003e in bribes was paid out to officials at schools including Yale, Georgetown, Stanford, UCLA, Wake Forest, and more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe alleged wrongdoing\u003c/strong\u003e included cheating on college entrance exams like the SAT and ACT and bribing coaches to say students were being \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/jackdickey/status/1105478734331723776\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecruited as athletes\u003c/a\u003e…“regardless of their athletic abilities, and in some cases, even though they did not play the sport they were purportedly recruited to play.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor example, Loughlin and her husband were charged with paying $500,000 in bribes to get their two daughters into USC as recruits for the rowing team...even though neither knew a coxswain from a stroke.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere's one example:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1552423528.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"540\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eVia \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/jackdickey\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e@jackdickey\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe roster of those charged reads like the Met Gala invite list\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re talking tiger parents like Huffman and Loughlin, Hercules Capital CEO Manuel Henriquez, ex-Pacific Investment Management CEO Douglas Hodge, and TPG Head of \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-12/tpg-s-bill-mcglashan-among-defendants-charged-in-college-scheme\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSocial Good\u003c/a\u003e William McGlashan.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWondering what this scheme would run you?\u003c/strong\u003e Prosecutors said parents \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-03-12/coaches-accused-by-u-s-in-scheme-over-college-entrance-exams?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaid anywhere\u003c/a\u003e from $100,000 to $6.5 million in bribes, with most payments totaling about $200,000. Each time a parent wanted to cheat a standardized test, they’d dish out $15,000 to $75,000, but we could've told them for free all you need to do is pick \"C.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe alleged fraud was the “largest college admittance scam ever charged by the Department of Justice,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/college-admittance-fraud-felicity-huffman-lori-loughlin-bf1fb194-1c73-4938-b268-b911e5ba421a.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficials said\u003c/a\u003e. And it confirms two long-held suspicions: 1) America’s rich hold the country’s elite university system in the palm of their hands, and 2) getting kids into the party school revered higher learning style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrounding Boeing’s 737 Max jet\u003c/a\u003e, the plane involved in two fatal crashes over the past five months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis is unexpected.\u003c/strong\u003e EASA and the FAA, the U.S. regulator, have a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/12/business/boeing-737-grounding-faa.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehistory of working together\u003c/a\u003e. So it’s surprising that the Europeans consider the popular plane a danger to safety while the U.S. has vouched for its \"continued airworthiness.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd what about Boeing?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli before Sunday’s crash in Ethiopia.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere's a useful map from \u003ca solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBloomberg\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHealth insurer UnitedHealth Group (+1.12%) announced yesterday that, starting next year, it’ll \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-healthcare-rebates-unitedhealth/unitedhealth-expands-discount-program-to-new-employer-sponsored-plans-idUSKBN1QT175\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpand a program\u003c/a\u003e that passes on drug discounts directly to consumers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat does that mean? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePeople who’ve struggled with high deductible payments and other out-of-pocket expenses could see their costs come down.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eUnitedHealth will require new clients to apply after-the-fact discounts (aka rebates) to consumers’ out-of-pocket expenses. \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/12/health/unitedhealthcare-lower-drug-prices-rebates.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePer the NYT\u003c/a\u003e, other companies have \u003cem\u003eoffered\u003c/em\u003e similar deals to employers, but UnitedHealth looks to be the first major insurer to \u003cem\u003erequire\u003c/em\u003e it (FYI, existing clients will be permitted to continue under the old system but are “encouraged” to switch).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo why now? \u003c/strong\u003eNothing like a little D.C. pressure to move the ball down the field. Lawmakers have blamed rebate programs for pushing up the list price of drugs and burdening consumers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnitedHealth said the expanded program will make consumers more likely to fill their prescriptions. Dick’s Sporting Goods (-11.17%) announced yesterday it’ll remove guns and other hunting goods from 125 of its stores.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome background: \u003c/strong\u003eJust over a year ago, Dick’s CEO Edward Stack learned the Parkland gunman \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/12/business/dicks-sporting-goods-stock-gun-control.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonce bought a gun\u003c/a\u003e from Dick’s. While that wasn’t the gun he used to kill 17 people last year, Stack was shaken.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat’s why he’s made it harder to buy guns at Dick’s—and why he’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/business-a-lobbying/433735-dicks-sporting-goods-pulling-guns-from-125-stores?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epressured Congress\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to pass gun safety measures.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDick’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/dicks-sporting-goods-to-remove-guns-from-125-stores-11552400663?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etested\u003c/a\u003e the fewer-guns approach in 10 stores last year. And if the expansion announced yesterday is successful, Dick’s will move to implement the same changes at more locations next year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Stack’s approach has invited both support and criticism...it could potentially hurt Dick’s business. Adjusted same-store sales fell 3.1% annually last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut there are
